thread.title: What's the most popular Halloween candy in N.J.?
thread.title_full: What's the most popular Halloween candy in N.J.?

author: Jeff Goldman | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: What's the most popular Halloween candy in N.J.?
text:
What's the most popular Halloween candy in N.J.? $$AS26.JPG None of the candies pictured above are the most popular Halloween candy in New Jersey, according to one survey. Russ DeSantis/For The Star Ledger ( ) Comments 
Who knew New Jersey had anything in common with North Dakota? 
The fourth-smallest state and the state with the fourth-fewest people are the only two states where Sour Patch Kids are the favorite Halloween candy, according to one survey. 
Of the 40,000 people asked nationally by Influenster.com, Reese's Peanut Butter Cups received the most votes . The sweet treat that won the popular vote in the most states was different. Candy Corn got the nod in Oregon, Wyoming, Tenesseee, Texas and South Carolina. Reese's Peanut Butter Cups took the vote in Connecticut and Rhode Island. RELATED: 7 of the most controversial Halloween costumes in recent years 
In what's undoubtedly a coincidence, Sour Patch Kids are manufactured by East-Hanover based Mondelēz International. That company also makes what is purportedly Pennsylvania's most popular holiday candy — Swedish Fish. New Yorkers went with another non-chocolate choice — Sweet Tarts. 
Take our survey to vote on your favorite candy. If your choice isn't included let us know what it is in the comments below. 
Jeff Goldman may be reached at jeff_goldman@njadvancemedia.com . Follow him on Twitter @JGoldmanNJ . Find NJ.com on Facebook . Can you guess your state's favorite Halloween candy? No peeking! https://t.co/6B3pRfJwLb pic.twitter.com/KJwkY1JzQa
